original: Lundberg, Tore Hjalmar, lektor, civilingenjör, Göteborg, f. 27/12/01 i Sallerup, Malmöh. i., av stat:skriv. Sven Theodor L. o. Signe Böttger. G. 32 m. Gunvor Jerlström. Barn: Birgitta f. 34, Håkan 39, Agneta 42. — Stud:ex. i Borås 20, utex. fr. CTI (M) 23. Stud:res. i USA 21, Tyskl. 22, Danm. 37, Belg. 38 o. En^l. 46. Ing. v. hampfabr. o. sågv. samt byggn:-ing. i Nairobi o. Mombasa i Afrika 23-31, vik. lär. v. Hässleholms tekn. ’sk. 32, e. o. lär. v. Kristianstads h. folksk. tekn. avd. 32-35, e. lär. v. Malmö tekn. lärov. 35-39, lektor v. Örebro tekn. gymn. 39, lektor i mek., håll-fasth :lära o. maskinteknik v. Gbgs tekn. gymn. sed. 45, spec :lär. i beskr. maskinlära v. CTH sed. 45. Skr.: Hållfasthetslära f. tekn. lärov.. Tabeller t. Hållfasthetslära, Hydromekanik f. tekn. lärov., Angtabeller, eit 10-tal kurs’er f. Hermods Korresp :inst., red. f. Svensk Ingenjörskalender.
translated: Lundberg, Tore Hjalmar, lecturer, civil engineer, Gothenburg, born on December 27, 1901 in Sallerup, Malmöhus county, son of civil servant Sven Theodor L. and Signe Böttger. Married in 1932 to Gunvor Jerlström. Children: Birgitta born in 1934, Håkan in 1939, Agneta in 1942. — Obtained high school diploma in Borås in 1920, graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology (M) in 1923. Studied abroad in the USA in 1921, Germany in 1922, Denmark in 1937, Belgium in 1938, and England in 1946. Worked as an engineer in a hemp factory and sawmill as well as in construction engineering in Nairobi and Mombasa in Africa from 1923 to 1931, substitute teacher at Hässleholm Technical School in 1932, assistant teacher at the technical department of Kristianstad Public School from 1932 to 1935, regular teacher at Malmö Technical High School from 1935 to 1939, lecturer at Örebro Technical High School from 1939, lecturer in mechanical engineering, strength of materials, and machinery technology at Gothenburg Technical High School since 1945, and special teacher in descriptive machine learning at the Chalmers University of Technology since 1945. Written works: Strength of materials for technical high schools. Tables for strength of materials, Hydromechanics for technical high schools, Angle tables, around 10 courses for Hermods Correspondence Institute, editor for the Swedish Engineer's Calendar.

structured.name: Tore Hjalmar Lundberg
structured.description: Tore Hjalmar Lundberg was a Swedish lecturer and civil engineer. He was born on December 27, 1901, in Sallerup, Sweden. Tore married Gunvor Jerlström in 1932, and they had three children, Birgitta, Håkan, and Agneta. Tore graduated from Borås High School in 1920 and the Royal Institute of Technology in 1923. He studied abroad in the USA, Germany, Denmark, Belgium, and England at various times. Tore worked as an engineer in a hemp factory, sawmill, and construction engineering in Nairobi and Mombasa, Africa, from 1923 to 1931. He then pursued a career in education, teaching at various technical high schools and serving as a lecturer at Gothenburg Technical High School and the Chalmers University of Technology. Tore authored several works, including 'Strength of Materials' and 'Hydromechanics' for technical high schools, as well as contributing to the 'Swedish Engineer's Calendar'.
